plots: Edla recently lost her husband: Nikulas is everything she has left
title: The Lure of of the World
objective: convince Nikulas to stay with his mother
tasks: counsel Nikulas on the perils of the world
description:
I'm Edla. I have a son. His name is Nikulas. He's a good lad, strong and loyal. I only wish he wasn't so eager to leave the village. I've tried to tell him that the world beyond our lands is dangerous and cruel, but he won't listen.
For now, I need Nikulas here. You see, his father, my husband, was recently lost to us. Nikulas is all that I have left in this world. I know it is selfish of me to say so, but I cannot lose him. Not while I still grieve. Also, I know his heart. Nikulas is reckless and foolish, like most young men. He cannot understand what awaits him in the wide world.
Could you talk to Nikulas? I know he would listen to you. You've been out there in the wide world. You know its perils.

plots: wants equipment
glistering melon slices are used to brew healing potions
title: A Helping Hand
objective: bring glistering melon slices to Cleo
description:
I am a farmer here in Seaside Settlement. Sometimes, I get a bountiful harvest of melons. I process most of the melons into glistering melon slices for clerics and their important healing potions.
I actually just finished preparing some glistering melon slices. Could you please take them to the cleric in the village of Humming Hills? I'm sure she'll pay you for them.

plots: Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos
title: Elisif's Tribute
objective: help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
tasks: take Torygg's war horn to the shrine
description:
There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.
As you may know Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire. When we buried my husband I made offerings to all the gods... except Talos. My husband Torygg would want a proper burial.
I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.
It would mean a lot to me.

plots: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player
title: An Offer
objective: help Calcelmo with his research
tasks: bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo
description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

plots: people around here have not been able to sleep for a week
title: Zombie Infestation
objective: return to Wenric after killing all zombies
description:
I be Wenric, a farmer by profession.
There's been something killing peoples in and 'round the farms here. Zombies or something. I can understands if you can't stomach the task but, just between you an' me real personal-likes, I don't know who else is gonna do it... All of us haves been goin' for a week now without sleep.
We've counted twenty zombies or so, so keep track as you kill 'em, if that's what you plans on doing.
Once you got 'em all, come back here and I'll gives you the 150 gold pieces that some of us have pooled together.

plots: NONE
title: Honor Thy Family
objective: regain the trust of your fellow Dark Brotherhood members
description:
You disrespected the Dark Brotherhood. And it'll cost you. You want back into the Family, you pay the price. 500 gold, and all is forgiven.
I suggest you "collect" it. Until you pay the fine, you are effectively cut off from all Dark Brotherhood duties and contracts.
No contracts. No rewards. No respect.

plots: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative
title: Revealing the Unseen
objective: learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
tasks: find the members of the Synod
description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

plots: the Dawnguard are getting the Dawnguard Fortress back into shape
Isran gives the player a crossbow: crossbows are good for hunting vampires before they get too close
title: Awakening
objective: find out what vampires are looking for at Dimhollow Crypt
tasks: meet Tolan, who will try to assist you
description:
I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
Go see what the vampires were looking for in Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there. Here, you should take a crossbow. Good for hunting out those fiends before they get too close.
Tolan'll meet you at Dimhollow. He will try to assist you. Watch out. Vigilants of Stendarr were never trained for vampire hunting...

plots: NONE
title: Bleak Falls Barrow
objective: retrieve the Dragonstone for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: find the Dragonstone in the main chamber of Bleak Falls Barrow
description:
I could use someone to fetch something for me. Well, when I say fetch, I really mean delve into a dangerous ruin in search of an ancient stone tablet that may or may not actually be there.
I, ah, learned of a certain stone tablet said to be housed in Bleak Falls Barrow - a 'Dragonstone,' said to contain a map of dragon burial sites. Go to Bleak Falls Barrow, find this tablet - no doubt interred in the main chamber - and bring it to me. Simplicity itself.

BG2101: in this area, atop a holy altar

plots: Gaal will gives the player a key to the inner chambers
the door to the inner chambers is located a short distance back the way the player came, at the sewer passages
title: Serve the One God
objective: retrieve an item for the One God
tasks: venture below, and retrieve the item
description:
I am Gaal, high priest of the One God.
There is... something that you could do that the great one cannot, despite his vast power.
The Unseeing Eye knows of a valuable item in this area.
The item is a rod... or part of a rod, rather, that you will find atop a holy altar. I cannot tell you more than that. You must let your faith guide you.
If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages.

plots: Ike Cascadion Vendar is leading a tour to Durlag's Tower
the tour to Durlag's Tower costs 60 gold
title: A Tour of Durlag's Tower
objective: take a tour to Durlag's Tower
tasks: buy a tour to Durlag's Tower from Ike Cascadion Vendar
description:
Step right up folks and HEAR the tale of dread placed before thee. Join with me as I, adventurer extraordinaire Ike Cascadion Vendar, lead yet another group of brave souls through the very SEAT of danger in the realms. To Durlag's Tower we shall go, and witness the perils that have taken the lives of hundreds of courageous men and women.
SEE the horror of the treacherous traps! FEEL the presence of the long languishing dead! MARVEL at the wondrous wealth buried below! NOT for the weak of spirit as I will NOT be held accountable for any heart failure during OR after our expedition! Step up, step up! One at a TIME!
A special package deal of 60 gold for you, not that you would need a discount.

plots: the player purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall
title: Helping Hands
objective: hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
tasks: pay Eyja 150 gold to hire her as your housekeeper
description:
Hello, I heard you purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall, and I was wondering if you had anyone in mind to fill that position?
For 150 gold and a roof over my head, I'm yours. Well, to help around the house I mean.

plots: NONE
title: Telrav's Request
objective: help Telrav
tasks: escort Telrav back to his camp nearby
description:
Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?
My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.

BG2218: the tomb of the founder of Trademeet in the Trademeet graveyard

plots: the player is the hero of Trademeet
the player spoke to Skarmaen before
the Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations
the Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that the Lurraxols are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it
Lady Lilith wants the Mantle of Waukeen to prove that her family founded Trademeet
Lady Lilith will give the player the key to the tomb
title: The Battle of Families
objective: bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lady Lilith
description:
Ah! It is the hero of Trademeet, come to see me at last. I trust that all is well? That pig, Skarmaen Alibakkar, did not speak too harshly about me, I trust? No matter. He is a stubborn, deluded fool. Our families have been at odds for generations, you see. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that we are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Why they would think themselves higher than they are is beyond my ken. What is unfortunate, however, is that my family has never had actual, physical proof of the truth of our claim.
That has changed, however. A tome has recently been uncovered... an old tome belonging to my family... that states there is proof right here in Trademeet under our noses. In the graveyard, here in town, lies the crypt of the founder... my ancestor. With him lies the Mantle of Waukeen. A pretty name for an old gold circlet. That circlet, however, would prove my claim once and for all and shut those Alibakkars up. I would get it myself, but the tomb is haunted, you see. Here is the key to the tomb... the fact that we possess it is yet more proof of our legitimacy. Use it to enter and obtain the mantle, and then return to me when you are done.
You are a hero who might enter that tomb and retrieve the circlet for me, if you are willing. In return, I will pay you 1,000 gold. What do you say, my hero?

plots: Gilbert wants knowledge
the player is an infamous person
title: Tools of the Enemy
objective: bring an Illager crossbow to Gilbert
description:
You are quite a mischievous person, aren't you? Maybe you'd like to do a small prank for me?
I want to get an Illager crossbow. See what makes it tick. The problem is, Illagers are quite a nasty bunch: they shoot anyone with their crossbows without discrimination.
Lift one of their crossbows from them, bring it to me, and I'll give you a powerful bow of my own making.

plots: Zara wants knowledge
the player is a known villain
title: A Witch of the Wild
objective: help Zara determine whether the rumors about a witch in Darkwater Bog are true
tasks: search Darkwater Bog for a witch
description:
Oh great. It's the evil-doer. Our village faces enough hardship even without the likes of you!
On the contrary... Perhaps evil plus evil equals good. There are rumors about a witch in living in a nearby swamp. Many villagers, myself included, worry about the presence of a witch. Would you like to search Darkwater Bog for that witch, and confirm whether the rumors are true?
Even a villain can't resist the price I'm willing to pay for that knowledge: 16 diamonds.

plots: NONE
title: Nadarin and the Basilisk
objective: kill a basilisk and return to Nadarin for your reward
description:
Hey, you! Are you either bored or foolish? Either way, I, Nadarin, could use your services.
Some wiseacre tried to send a basilisk by freight and now it's broken free and is making a mess of one of the warehouses at the harbor.
There'll be 500 gold pieces for taking care of that on such short notice. Also, you might want these. They're an item I obtained from a fence I know in a far-away city. You never know, they might fit you.

plots: Feldepost hired some thugs to hurt Silke Rosena, because she did not perform at Feldepost's inn when she was supposed to
title: The Silke Dilemma
objective: become a bodyguard for Silke Rosena
description:
Hail, adventurers. I'm Garrick, and I work for Silke Rosena. She's the most skilled musician and actor along the Sword Coast. 
I have a proposal for you. How would you like a well-paying job as a bodyguard for my mistress? She's been having some problems of late. Some thugs have been hired by Feldepost to hurt her bad because she didn't perform at his inn when she was supposed to. You can't blame her for not showing up, what with a villain like Feldepost running the place.
Just meet me outside of the Red Sheaf Inn, if you are interested in the job.

plots: wants conquest
the player is a known villain
title: Dark Rule
objective: conquer Desert Refuge
tasks: kill all villagers who oppose you
description:
Master, the desert village of Desert Refuge is ripe for taking! Your dark domain will grow vastly, if you were to conquer it!
Master, you should go to Desert Refuge, and kill all villagers you oppose you! The ones who don't, on the contrary, should make terrific new minions for you!

plots: Vaermina has an awful hunger for people's memories: in return, she leaves behind nightmares
title: Waking Nightmare
objective: relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
tasks: return to Nightcaller Temple with Erandur, and help him end the nightmares
description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

plots: Barthel Gernand and his family ran into goblin war parties northwest of here while starting to build a new settlement
title: Goblin Trouble
objective: stop a goblin war so that Barthel Gernand and his family can finish building their new settlement
tasks: talk to Mirisa about the goblins
description:
A word of advice! Watch for goblins if you're heading north. We ran into goblin war parties northwest of here, while starting to build a new settlement.
My family and I are still trying to figure out what to do. We spent everything we had to buy the land and supplies, so we can hardly go back.
Say, do you think you could help us? We need to get the goblins off our land so we can start building our new settlement. You should talk to Mirisa about the goblins. She's our guide and knows what needs to be done.
Take care, friend. Don't get yourself killed on our account.

plots: the player is an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake
Umaril the Unfeathered's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death
title: Umaril the Unfeathered
objective: defeat Umaril the Unfeathered and kill him for good, in both the physical and spiritual planes
description:
Hear my final passings of praise and wisdom!
You have stepped from the humble shadows of obscurity and into legend. No feat you have accomplished in your life compares to what you have become. You are an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake, the bane of Umaril the Unfeathered.
The time has come for you to fulfill your destiny. Umaril lies hid in the ancient fane of Garlas Malatar. You must go there and destroy him. Umaril's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death. This is what Pelinal learned upon defeating Umaril the first time. You must first kill his living body. While beyond the power of most mortals, this is only the lesser of your two tasks. It will allow you to follow Umaril into the spirit realm upon his death. It will allow you to destroy him, body and soul, utterly and for all time.

TESS193: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest

plots: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood
title: Sanctuary
objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
tasks: find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door
description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

plots: NONE
title: *Seeing Things
objective: help Guard kill invisible demons
tasks: kill the invisible demons that surround Guard
description:
Thank the Gods you're here! These... demons just came out of nowhere! I've been able to hold them off so far, but, with you here, we'll soon triumph over them!
Why are you looking at me like that? Can't you see them? They're all around us! Please... you've got to believe me!

plots: Haer'Dalis is an actor in Raelis Shai's troupe
Haer'Dalis was captured by Mekrath because Mekrath coveted Haer'Dalis' gem
title: Free Haer'Dalis from Inprisonment by Mekrath
objective: return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe
description:
I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so.

plots: Yamarz became weak: the giants sense Yamarz's weakness, and intrude on the orc clan's territory
Atub must petition Malacath for relief: the ritual must be done at the walled orc camp
title: The Cursed Tribe
objective: Help lift the curse placed on Yamarz
tasks: bring Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart to Atub
description:
Please, our tribe suffers and we need help.
Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home.
Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need. He has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need.
I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.

plots: Dawnbringer Sain is supposed to acquire art for the temple of Lathander
title: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Lathander
objective: convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander
description:
Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter.

plots: Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin, because Seed-Neeus was not feeling well
Dar-Ma went with Blossom
title: A Shadow Over Hackdirt
objective: find Dar-Ma
tasks: find clues about Dar-Ma's whereabouts from Etira Moslin
description:
I'm Seed-Neeus. I don't mean to impose, but I'm hoping you can help me. My daughter, Dar-Ma is missing and I don't know what to do.
Dar-Ma never came back from Hackdirt. I'm dreadfully worried something may have happened to her. Can you help?
Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin in Hackdirt, so I would start there. Hackdirt is a rather isolated village, south of Chorrol. We do some business with the trader there. Small volume, but she pays well. Normally I make the deliveries, but I wasn't feeling well so Dar-Ma insisted on going this time. In case it may be useful, she was with Blossom -- her horse, I mean. Dar-Ma loves that animal, and would never willingly abandon her.
If you find my daughter, you have my friendship and gratitude to the end of my days!

plots: Martin has everything in place for the Mysterium Xarxes: Martin will open the portal whenever the player is ready
the portal Martin creates through the Mysterium Xarxes will close behind the player: the player will have to find another way back
Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place
title: Paradise
objective: kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
tasks: travel through Martin's portal to Mankar Camoran's Paradise
description:
I have everything in place for the ritual. I'll open the portal whenever you're ready. I don't know what you'll find in Camoran's Paradise. I do know the portal I create through the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will close behind you. You'll have to find another way back.
I believe that Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place. Kill Mankar Camoran, and you will unmake his Paradise.
Farewell, my friend. Our fate is in your hands. Bring back the Amulet of Kings. Brace yourself.

plots: the player is the Dragonborn
title: The Words of Power
objective: find a lost word of power
tasks: get to the location marked on your map
description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

plots: Anders wants comfort
Anders has heard that the player help people
title: Look at the Time Fly
objective: give a clock to Anders
description:
I don't know when nightfall arrives. As night falls, the world is inherited by monsters, and outdoors become much more dangerous! Even within the village! I could be in the middle of some important task, and then a zombie might attack and kill me!
You have been helping others: maybe you could help me too. I want a clock to keep track of time more easily. Would you kindly obtain one?
I have some blocks of iron for you...

plots: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel
title: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
tasks: fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice
description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires.
You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

plots: NONE
title: Harsh Master
objective: take care of a runaway sailor and his gang of thieves
description:
The North Wind is my mistress, and I'm her master. I don't tolerate any disloyalty. You looking for work? Got a sailor who thought running a gang of thieves would be more money than hauling my cargo.
You make an example of that gang, I'll give you a year's worth of pay.  Don't spend it all on mead.

TESS181: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock
TESS184: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

plots: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks
title: Recipe for Distraction
objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
tasks: locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

plots: NONE
title: The Sweep Job
objective: clear out valuables from Atheron Residence
description:
One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables.
If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning by stealing three items of value.
The place in question is the Atheron Residence in Windhelm. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail.
How about you make them pay for that? Just remember the order: do job first, get drunk second.

plots: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold
title: Magic Student
objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

plots: the player is the new Arch-Mage after Traven
title: Alchemy Acquisitions
objective: use the expertise of Julienne Fanis for your own benefit
tasks: talk to Julienne Fanis about her collecting alchemical ingredients for you
description:
As the Arch-Mage, you are entitled to certain privileges.
In addition to the full use of all Guild facilities, there is one service available to you. Julienne Fanis has long served Arch-Mage Traven in collecting alchemical ingredients for his personal research. As the new Arch-Mage, I'm sure she'll extend the service to you as well.
At your convenience, consult her at the Lustratorium.

plots: Melicamp of Beregost was turned into a chicken by a spell gone wrong
Melicamp of Beregost will nest in the player's pack
title: Melicamp the Chicken
objective: turn Melicamp of Beregost back into a human from a chicken
description:
Buc-becaw! HELLLLP-becaw! I am "no ordinary talking chicken," and I am in need of your *cluck* help. I am Melicamp of Beregost, a *cluck* mage adept in the mystical arts.
A... misread... incantation seems to be *cluck* the source of my troubling form. 'Tis been over a month since I *cluck* uttered a polymorph spell, and I simply cannot return to my normal *cluck* form!
There is a tower directly to the west of *cluck* Beregost, about which can be found the mage Thalantyr. I am his apprentice, and I am certain he will *cluck* aid me. I'll just nestle in your pack until we get there.

plots: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair
title: Kyne's Sacred Trials
objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki
description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

plots: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing
title: The Cure for Madness
objective: confront Cicero and kill him
tasks: find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings
description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

plots: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty
title: Painting the Seas Red
objective: assassinate Safia
description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

MC111: "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"
MC112: "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"
MC113: "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"

plots: John wants knowledge
the player is a famous hero
title: A Mine of Knowledge
objective: recover "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane" for John
tasks: find "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"
description:
To have more tomes in my library... Now that would be incredibly lovely...
Oh hero, I was just dreaming about having more precious, amazing books. Actually, you could recover a book for me. It is called "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane", and it tells about the hellish dimension your familiar with. You can find it in a nearby mineshaft.
I'm willing to part from an enchanted book, should you succeed in recovering "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane".

plots: Hunter wants reputation
NONE
title: The Call of Adventure
objective: bring a sword and a suit of armor to Hunter
description:
I do not want to spend my whole life in this village! I want to become an adventurer, like you. Maybe even make a name for myself...
Can you please help me start my life as an adventurer? I just need a sword and a suit of armor to keep myself save from danger. You can get swords from weaponsmiths and armor from armorers.
I collected some amethyst shards when I was a child dreaming of adventure. You can have them. You may yet find a use for them.

TESO294: a Guild Hall of the Mages Guild
TESO295: a Guild Hall of the Mages Guild

plots: NONE
title: A Missing Mage
objective: find Erthor
description:
My research occupies nearly all of my time.
Now that I think about it, I do have a small problem concerning Erthor. He's one of the guild mages here. Think you can do something about it?
I just don't have the time to search for him again, but I do need to consult him about some notes he borrowed. You might want to ask around the Guild Hall, and see if anyone can be of some help. Let me know when he's back, and you'll have your recommendation.

plots: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one demented and other manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there are rules and he does not want to end up on the Hill of Suicides
title: The Great Divide
objective: resolve the trouble of doubles
tasks: kill the demented citizens of Split
description:
Yes, I, Horkvir Bear-Arm, can take a moment to talk with you.
I'd get more work done if it weren't for my layabout double living in town. Terrible drain on productivity. Never know who's who. It's been a problem for too long.
A wizard did it. Stupid layabout mage. Had a theory about each of us having a Manic and Demented side. He decided to test the theory. Cast a spell. Split us all in two. Do we get twice the work done? No! Ridiculous. We're not allowed to take care of it either. There are rules. And I don't want to end up on the Hill of Suicides. You, on the other hand....
Get rid of that Demented bunch. Useless, anyway. Don't get a lick of work done around Split. If you get rid of them, I'll make it worth your while.

plots: Garren Windspear left his home in the player's care
Jierdan Firkraag and his hooligans kidnapped Garren Windspear's daughter from Garren Windspear's home
the player will travel unmolested, because Garren Windspear pleaded the player's virtue at the Radiant Heart
title: Rescue Garren's Child from Firkraag
objective: rescue Garren Windspear's daughter, and avenge the slain knights of the Radiant Heart
description:
My daughter is gone! I left my home in your care! I... I... no, no, I know it was not you... I know who my enemies are. Damn that Jierdan Firkraag! What is his grief with me?! I don't know where you will find him. His hooligans prevent searching. I don't know... Perhaps the ruins in the northeast? I don't know...
Please rescue my child, no matter the risk. You will travel unmolested, for my pleas of your virtue were heard at the Radiant Heart. They demand justice for the slain knights, so that is your task now. Do this, and your honor shall be restored.

plots: Jaella just lies in bed staring at the wall
title: Lissa's Daughter Needs Healing
objective: heal Jaella
tasks: find out what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition
description:
My name is Lissa. Something's wrong with my daughter.
Her name is Jaella. She's hurt, traveler. I don't know what's wrong with her. She just lies in bed staring at the wall. Won't even eat.
Please heal her. She's just a little girl. Please, you must go and find out exactly what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition. You'll find him in the basement.

plots: Burz gro-Khash has one more contract for the player
title: Mystery at Harlun's Watch
objective: investigate the disappearances at Harlun's Watch
tasks: talk to Drarana Thelis for the details about the missing people
description:
I've got one more contract for you, meat. I assume you can handle it. I need you to investigate some disappearances at Harlun's Watch.
We've been contracted to find out what's happened. Speak to Drarana Thelis for all the details.
Get going.

BG258: the storefront in the central docks
BG259: the storefront in the central docks

plots: Renal will give the player papers which say that the player was being transferred by the Shadowmaster
the player is supposed to spy on Mae'Var from the inside
the player will need to reassure Mae'Var
title: Find Proof of Mae'Var's Treachery
objective: find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
tasks: show the papers to Gorch to gain access to Mae'Var's guild house
description:
My name is Renal, as I'm sure you've been told. Renal "Bloodscalp"... a little nickname I've earned over time. Rather grisly, but it keeps the fearful in line.
One of my guild houses to the south is run by a rather ambitious fellow named Mae'Var. Good thief, but I never liked him. Now I know why. I've had some hints that he is getting too big for himself. Thinking of taking my place, I suspect, but I've had no real evidence to say that this is so.
I will give you papers saying you were being transferred by the Shadowmaster. You will spy on Mae'Var from the inside and find me the evidence that I need. You'll need to reassure Mae'Var, naturally. He won't know who you are, but I am confident that you are more than capable of this.
Just head to the storefront in the central docks area and speak to the storekeeper, Gorch. Show the papers to him, and he'll let you in the guild house proper.
I think you will find the reward adequate. 10,000 gold is no small fortune, though I think you deserve a little more. From my personal armory, a sword.

plots: Lucien Lachance has been framed as the traitor to the Dark Brotherhood: Fort Farragut is under watch by the Black Hand
title: Following a Lead
objective: uncover the true traitor's identity, and come see Lucien Lachance at Applewatch
tasks: go to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract
description:
You and I have been deceived, dear friend. We must find out who is behind this betrayal! We haven't much time... I am hunted day and night by the Black Hand! They want me dead!
Here is what you must do. Go now to your next dead drop, lie in wait, and confront whomever drops off the false contract!
Uncover the true traitor's identity, and then come see me. I'll be in hiding. Fort Farragut is no longer secure. It's under watch by the Black Hand. I'll wait for you at Applewatch, the farm where you killed the old Draconis woman. It should be empty, and safe.
Now go! And may the god of death help us all!

plots: the player is meeting Harkon for the first time: Harkon and his family are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim
the player returned Harkon's daughter and her Elder Scroll to him
title: Bloodline
objective: become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
tasks: decide whether you want to become a vampire or remain mortal
description:
I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter.
I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
However, if you refuse my gift you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
I await your decision.

plots: NONE
title: The Heist Job
objective: steal an item from a store strongbox
description:
Every now and again, we like to remind the shopkeepers that we're in charge. If that means breaking into their strongboxes and stealing something valuable from them, then so be it.
Feel like doing a bit of shopping... the Guild way? The owner of this shop stiffed us on their last protection payment, but we're taking it anyway.

TESO261: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground
TESO262: Sunken One, He Who Shakes The Ground

plots: Kvatch was destroyed because they did not heed Slythe Seringi's warning about the Sunken One
Slythe Seringi has gone to give an offering to the Sunken One so that he does not sack any other cities: Anvil, Chorrol, the Imperial City
title: The Sunken One
objective: investigate the Sunken One
description:
Slythe's Journal
by Slythe Seringi

As midnight approaches, I still watch the fires burn. The great city of man, Kvatch, lay in ruins. They didn't heed my words. They didn't listen to my voice. Now, they are all paying the cost of ignorance. The Sunken One strikes swift and hard. He swats those who oppose Him as if they did not exist at all. The excuses of man fall upon deaf ears. The Sunken One has no pity; He has no mercy, He only sits below and passes sentence. And now, with a mighty stroke, He's toppled one of man's pitiful blights on His land. And yet, He still hungers. His appetite is voracious. Kvatch will not be the last city to fall by His hand. The world of man grows more and more corrupt, and it angers Him. Man's lies and deceit will be his undoing as The Sunken One grows impatient and no longer waits for or accepts the proper offering.
The burden is mine to shoulder. I am the last who knows of He Who Shakes The Ground. If I do not bring him the Offering, who knows what city may fall prey to his whim? Anvil? Chorrol? Or perhaps He will turn his eyes on the greatest boil of all, the great Imperial City itself. No, I must not let that happen. I must get the Offering to him like my father did before me. Man may be fallen in His eyes, but they must have time to learn The Sunken One's teachings. Destroying man now would be a waste, when I am certain that given the chance, they will come to see His ways. Yes, I will do this thing. I will brave the depths of Sandstone Cavern to see Him. My weapons will be my will and my word. The Sunken One will watch over me and guide me. I must depart soon, before it is too late. If anyone finds this journal, let them know that I, Slythe Seringi, do this for the good of all man.

plots: NONE
title: The Book of Love
objective: act as the hands of Mara in the world
tasks: help Fastred with her fickle love
description:
I am devoted to the Goddess Mara, who gave mortals the gift of love that they might have a hint of eternity. Her blessings are many. To love is to know the true nature of the gods.
Not all can hear the broad echoes of deepest dawn. To receive the touch of Mara, you must first act as her hands in the world. Explore the facets of the infinite jewel. Are you prepared, then, to help bring the light across this land?
The dawn surely opens upon you, child. You must bear its light that all may see. Mara has reflected an image to me. A young woman... almost a girl... her fickle love must resolve itself. The village of Ivarstead. The woman, Fastred. This is the prayer heard by the goddess and relayed to her servants.
Return when Fastred has seen her path. I will entreat Mara on your behalf.

plots: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it
title: The Jagged Crown
objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
tasks: meet Galmar Stone-Fist and your fellow Stormcloaks
description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

plots: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead
title: Discerning the Transmundane
objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you
description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls
title: Prophet
objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

plots: Roggvir died: Svari's mother took his death hard
title: Return to Grace
objective: convince Svari's mother to go to temple
description:
Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.
Maybe you could convince her. You should go do it right now.

plots: Euric ran away from home
Nadine gives the player a good luck talisman
title: Nadine and Euric
objective: give Euric a good luck talisman and return to Nadine
description:
I, Nadine, desperately need someone's help.
Euric, my youngest son, has run away again... He's always had a touch of the wanderer in him and he knows how to take care of himself, but... Oh, I'm just worried sick. This city gets more dangerous every day... If you find him, could you give him this good luck talisman? I'm sure we'd all sleep a little better.
Let me give you this necklace as a token of my thanks upon your return. I don't know if it's worth anything but it has been in the family for years.

plots: NONE
title: Ancient Technology
objective: retrieve Dwemer schematics for Sorine Jurard
description:
I want to add some punch to our crossbow capabilities, I've done all I can on my own. I need a little inspiration. I've always been fascinated with Dwemer artifacts. I take them apart, poke around in their guts, and try to figure things out - with mixed results.
But as luck would have it, I've tracked down the location of some actual Dwemer diagram drawings! So, if you'd be a dear and collect those plans for me at Irkngthand?
With the Dwemer diagrams and a little tinkering I should be able to improve the capabilities of our crossbows.

plots: Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there
title: Rjorn's Drum
objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

plots: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels
title: Evil in Waiting
objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
tasks: collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar
description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

plots: the player is a member of the Dark Brotherhood
Titus Mede II will be surrounded by elite bodyguards, but they might be more lax than usual because everyone assumes that the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed
title: Hail Sithis!
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II
description:
The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet. But you must hurry!
If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted... I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
This is the true Emperor, not some half-penny lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still... everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.

plots: the Knights of the Nine failed to uphold their knightly vows in life: they uphold them in death and do not let unworthy souls take the Cuirass of the Crusader
title: Priory of the Nine
objective: retrieve the Cuirass of the Crusader for yourself
tasks: defeat the ghosts of the Knights of the Nine in honorable combat
description:
By the strength and guidance of the Nine, who comes before us upon this sacred ground seeking the Cuirass of the Divine Crusader?
Step forward, adventurer, and face us, the Knights of the Nine, each in honorable combat. For the vows we failed to revere in life, we shall uphold in death. No unworthy soul shall lay hands upon this sacred artifact without the leave of the Knights of the Nine.

BG1249: the badlands to the south of Beregost
BG1250: the badlands to the south of Beregost

plots: NONE
title: Zhurlong's Missing Boots
objective: return Zhurlong's Boots of Stealth to their owner
tasks: find the hobgoblins who stole Zhurlong's Boots of Stealth
description:
Hey, I'm Zhurlong! What is a thief to do, huh? You invest in some Boots of Stealth, you set up shop in the badlands to the south of Beregost and then, WHAM... Along comes a tribe of hobgoblins and they tear the boots from right off your feet!
Damn-blasted hobgoblin bullies... I'll pay you 100 gold pieces to show them who's boss and get those boots back...

plots: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it
title: Old Friends
objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns
description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

TESO554: during the day, out under the waves in the bay
TESO555: during the day, out under the waves in the bay

plots: the player told Tooth-in-the-Sea that they want to learn Alteration from him
the player must stay underwater with Tooth-in-the-Sea for three hours: the player must not wander off or they fail the test
title: Alteration Training
objective: prove Tooth-in-the-Sea that you are worthy of Alteration training
description:
Would you learn from me? Then meet me during the day, out under the waves in the bay.
If you wish to learn what I know about Alteration, then you must stay there with me for a full three hours. How you manage to do this is up to you; do not wander off, or I shall consider this test of your ability failed.

plots: Lee wants comfort
cyan dye is made by combining green dye and blue dye
title: Showing Your True Colors
objective: bring 16 cyan dye to Lee
description:
I want to make my leather works more... dashing and colorful.
Bring me 16 cyan dye, and I'll reward you with 32 emeralds. You can make cyan dye by combining green dye with blue dye, I think. I'd obtain the dye myself, but the smell of my tanning chemicals attracts all sorts of unsavory creatures to me out there.

plots: NONE
title: Truffle Kerfuffle
objective: bring 12 Ember Truffles to Clive
description:
I'm a botanist, serving the Empire by gathering various Ember-infused plants.  And I've found a virtual treasure trove of Ember Truffles, down in the Muckery... but some of them have already attained sentience, and that's making it difficult for me to gather them.
If you can bring me, say, a dozen Ember Truffles, I'll keep ten for the Empire, and I'll use the other two to make a Super Mana Potion for you.
Do we have a deal?

MC200: a hidden camp on a mountain

plots: Finn wants reputation
NONE
title: Exclusively Here!
objective: bring "An Interview With the Enderman" to Finn
tasks: convince A.R. sign an exclusivity deal with Villager
description:
No one cares about libraries any more! Everyone just buys their books, even though they could read them for free!
There's only one thing I can do to make my library more popular: exclusive books. I'd like to secure an exclusivity deal with A.R., a very famous novelist. She has just finished her new book, "An Interview with the Enderman", while staying at a hidden camp on a mountain.
Could you please get to A.R.'s camp and convince her to sign the exclusivity deal? Bring back a copy of "An Interview with the Enderman" too. I'd like to read it myself. You can have 32 name tags as a reward, keeping things named and ordered is always useful.

TESS178: a cave nearby, guarded by wolves

plots: NONE
title: Dragon's Breath Mead
objective: retrieve the Dragon's Breath Mead and give it to Olda
description:
My husband Horgeir promised me, swore on his ancestors, that he'd give up the mead. And what do I find out?
He's been stashing drink in a cave nearby. He even has some wolves guarding it. I swear, I should just cut out his tongue. That would be the end of it.
You could get Horgeir's stash for me, but I'll keep my dagger sharpened just in case. You can help yourself to any drink you find, but bring me the bottle of Dragon's Breath Mead. It's his favorite, so I know he has one there.

plots: Serana thinks that the player can't trust Harkon after they spoke with Serana's mother in the Soul Cairn: the player can't bring the bow to Harkon
title: Kindred Judgment
objective: kill Harkon
description:
I think we both know... it's time to face my father Harkon. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her... I don't think we can trust him. No. He has to die. We have no choice.
Let's face him together.

plots: NONE
title: Azra's Staffs
objective: retrieve a magical staff made by Azra Nightwielder for Neloth
description:
I have a slightly more personal request. You see, I'm a collector. Of staffs. Magical staffs. In particular, those made by Azra Nightwielder.
Azra Nightwielder was the original shadowmage. His advances in magic are legendary. Less well known is that he was also a pioneer in the field of enchanting staffs. Nightwielder's creations don't really hold up in comparison to what can be made today, but they have a sentimental value for me. You understand.
Through some divinations, I believe I've located one of Azra Nightwielder's staffs in Frostmere Depths. If you retrieve it, I'll give you a staff of my own making.

plots: the player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters
title: Berries for Elmus
objective: retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
description:
We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round.

plots: a tasloi stole Gurke's cloak in Cloakwood
title: Gurke's Cloak
objective: return Gurke's cloak to him
tasks: find the tasloi holding Gurke's cloak
description:
Old Gurke had his famous cloak stolen right off his back by a batch of paltry tasloi.
Yeah, yeah, it's old news and if you make one crack about the Cloakwood being an appropriate place to lose it, at least, I'll put your liver on the menu. Now move on and let the next people in line have their laugh.
However, if you happen to find my cloak, I'll give you 280 gold pieces for returning it.

TESS918: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS919: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS920: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS921: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella
TESS922: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

plots: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella
title: Caught Red Handed
objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga
tasks: gather 3 Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn, and confront Haelga with the Marks of Dibella
description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

plots: the player asked Vex information about Vald
title: Vald's Debt
objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts
description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

plots: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it
title: Prophet of the Night
objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim
description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

plots: Hareph left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become aggressive
title: The Missing Man
objective: find out what happened to Hareph
description:
If you're heading out into the Salt Barrens, could you find out what happened to my companion Hareph?
He left with a crew to determine why the Skara have become so aggressive lately, but no one has come back.
If you travel North to the Swarm Stacks, you should be able to find him - or at least what happened to him.

plots: NONE
title: The Prey
objective: remind the Dawnguard that they are the prey
tasks: track down a Dawnguard member, and kill him discreetly
description:
I've learned the whereabouts of a troublesome Dawnguard member. You will track him down and dispose of him.
But please, do be discreet. Don't. Get. Caught. Our aim isn't to stir the nest, just to skin a rat, reminding them that they are the prey.

plots: the Gourmet is the last target before he Dark Brotherhood strikes out at the emperor: the Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the emperor at a special dinner
Festus is close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet
title: Recipe for Disaster
objective: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
description:
There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor.
Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner.
You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

plots: Commander Brage found a cursed sword and killed his family
Commander Brage was a well-liked man before the cursed sword changed him
title: The Tale of Commander Brage
objective: kill Commander Brage
description:
State your business with the guard and go! Oh, that came out a bit harsher than I meant. I am sorry for my mood. All the guard are still grieving the loss of Commander Brage.
The commander was friend to many before he found a cursed sword. He's not the man he was, by Helm. I'll not believe a man of Brage's rank could kill his own family. 'Twas evil magics of some sort. An entire unit went west after Brage to try to talk some sense to him. It's been a week, and none have returned.
The reward for the commander's head is a king's ransom, but I'll not be lifting MY sword against a brother soldier.
Travel lightly, wanderer. The woods harbor strange things.

plots: the player walked on Zordral while he tried to kill Bentha
Zordral believes that Bentha is evil
Zordral thinks that the player is a threat to him and tries to kill the player too
title: Zordral's Witchhunt
objective: save yourself and Bentha from Zordral's wrath
description:
You there, stay back! If any of you come any closer, I'll kill her. I'm serious. Don't make me do it. All I have to do is say the last word of my spell and she'll die.
She's a witch. She'll use her magics to poison the children of this town. She'll butcher the livestock and she'll seduce the young men, make them her puppets. She must be killed!
Are you mocking me?! No one mocks the great Zordral. You will pay for your insolence!

plots: NONE
title: Payment Delivery
objective: help Pactur alleviate Bryling's wrath about missing shipments
tasks: tell Bryling that there will be a shipment soon
description:
Bryling's already come down hard on us for missing shipments. Likely to do it again, since we're late.
You could take word to her in Solitude that there'll be a shipment soon. Buy us some time and keep her off our backs. In exchange, I'm willing to let a few ingots go missing. Maybe more than a few.
You'd do me quite a favor. I wouldn't forget it. I'm sure she'll be angry. Brace yourself.

plots: the player asked a recommendation to Raminus from Jeanne Frasoric: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild
if someone from the Council were to visit Bruma Mages Guild, and find out that J'skar has vanished, it would look bad on Jeanne Frasoric
Volanaro thinks J'skar's spell backfired
title: Magely Mischief
objective: find J'skar, and make him re-appear
tasks: talk to the mages about J'skar's disappearance
description:
A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

plots: Ma'dran would help Ysolda start her own business for a mammoth's tusk
title: A Mammoth Powered Startup
objective: bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
description:
I'm Ysolda. Before my ma and da passed, I told them that one day, I'd become the best trader in Skyrim.
I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

plots: Liefnarr went to trade some grain with people at Broken Helm Hollow: he never came back
title: Flight or Fight
objective: tell Liefnarr that he is not welcome home
description:
My husband Liefnarr said he was going east towards the border of Morrowind to trade some of our grain to some folks at Broken Helm Hollow.
I waited and waited, and he never came back. Probably shacked up with some elven whore. Good riddance to him I say. If I only knew where he was, I'd sure give him a piece of my mind.
If you see him, tell him Grosta said he can go straight to hell... he's not welcome here any more.

plots: the player told Gruiand Garrana that they want to better themselves
title: Speechcraft Training
objective: do a task for Gruiand Garrana and return to her afterwards
description:
I am Gruiand Garrana. You would seek to better yourself?
First, I would ask that you look to the poor and the suffering around Cyrodiil. Travel to all of our cities, and speak with the unfortunate souls forced to beg for change. Look into their hearts, and then look into your own.
Return to me when you have spoken with all of them. Then we shall talk of training.

plots: Firebead Elvenhair left his identify scroll to Tethtoril
title: Firebead's Scroll
objective: bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
tasks: get Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll from Tethtoril
description:
I, Firebead Elvenhair, have a small errand for you.
I left an identify scroll with Tethtoril, in the inner grounds. He should be done examining it by now, so if you could fetch it for me, I'd be grateful. I have a great use for those types of scrolls.
Allow me to cast a little spell on you as a reward. It will protect you from any evil you might meet tonight.

plots: Edovar stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin: he died while trying to use the Glyph of Balthazar and was trapped drowning forever
title: Wash Away My Sins
objective: set Edovar free
description:
I am merely spirit, but I mean you no harm. In life, I was an ambitious thief, and I thought I was invincible. My greatest achievement was when I stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin. I thought I could master its power over water, but I was very, very wrong.
Now I am trapped here in eternal torment, drowning forever, unable to rectify my mistake. Will you return the Glyph of Balthazar to the Wellspring Basin, and set my spirit free at last?

plots: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones
title: The Gift
objective: turn your wife into a vampire
tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck
description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

plots: Mario wants knowledge
NONE
title: Hermit Knowledge
objective: ask Lone Wolf about the meaning of life, and return to Mario
description:
There is a strange woman living alone out in the Lily Forest. Some say that she knows the meaning of life!
Could you find her in that flower forest, and ask her about it? I really want to hear what could possibly be the meaning of life.
When you return, I'll have a little something for you. A compass. May it point you toward your destinations in life!

plots: Sandy wants comfort
the player is a known villain
title: Where to Hang...
objective: bring a painting to Sandy
description:
*scream of terror* I.. I.. I don't want any trouble. Please, I just want to live my live in peace.
You're not going to kill me? Sinister master, may this mere woman ask a tribute from you? Please, I'd like to have a painting.
In return, you will receive 16 TNT, perfect for ramping up explosions (Preferably elsewhere).

plots: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes
title: Dominion and Humiliation
objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment
description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

plots: NONE
title: The Elven Maiden
objective: steal a bust of Llathasa Indarys, and bring it back to Armand Christophe
tasks: ask the beggars where to find the bust of Llathasa Indarys
description:
The Guild has received a 'request' to obtain a unique statuette. It is a bust of Llathasa Indarys, the recently slain Countess of Cheydinhal. You will be paid a modest sum. Do you want this job?
Travel to Cheydinhal, and ask the beggars for more information about the bust.
Bring it back to me once you have it.

plots: Martin has deciphered one of the four items needed for the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise with the Mysterium Xarxes: the blood of a Daedra Lord
"Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults: the library here has a copy
the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the Daedric artifact
title: Blood of the Daedra
objective: acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin
tasks: locate one of the Daedric cults
description:
I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power.

plots: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves
title: Noster's Lost Helmet
objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

plots: NONE
title: A Lovely Letter
objective: use a forged letter to resolve a love triangle between Faendal, Sven, and Camilla Valerius
tasks: take the forged letter to Camilla Valerius and say that it is from Sven
description:
Sven is a bard, so he says. Occasionally he finds time to do his job here at the mill. Thinks his ballads and sonnets are going to convince Camilla Valerius to marry him. As if she would say "yes".
An intelligent, beautiful woman like her wouldn't fall for that nonsense... I hope. I've been thinking... maybe Camilla needs a little help seeing Sven for what he is. Could you... could you give her this letter, and say it's from Sven? I think I've matched that Nord's lack of cleverness perfectly.
I would appreciate your help. You could take some gold I've saved up from working at the mill.
